title: Madonna, 61, opts for comfort in a cosy patterned jumper ahead of her concert in NY
text:
She's been keeping busy by captivating audiences during her eleventh concert tour, Madame X, in the Big Apple.

And Madonna proved there's no rest for the wicked as she arrived at the Howard Gilman Opera House in Brooklyn, New York, ahead of her show on Wednesday afternoon.

Putting on a typically kooky display, the Queen Of Pop, 61, sported a pair of cropped joggers, teamed with semi-sheer black tights.

Busy bee: Madonna proved there's no rest for the wicked as she arrived at the Howard Gilman Opera House in Brooklyn, New York, ahead of her show on Wednesday afternoon

The 4 Minutes hitmaker maintained her eccentric appearance in a cosy hooded jumper, embellished with red paisley printing and the letters 'VU' emblazoned across it.

Songstress Madonna upped the style ante as she boosted her frame in a pair of heeled brogues, while accessorising her look with a feather print fedora, ski-inspired shades and a selection of gold jewellery.

Madonna is scheduled to perform in New York until October 12, before jetting to Chicago till the end of the month.

The media personality will take to the stage in other parts of the US, before kicking off the European leg of her tour in Lisbon next year.

Wow-factor! Putting on a typically kooky display, the Queen Of Pop, 61, sported a pair of cropped joggers, teamed with semi-sheer black tights

However, The Sun reports that the American singer's time in the country may soon be coming to an end, as the owners of the £6million 18th century palace she calls home are now allegedly planning to sell it.

Her low-key appearance comes as it's said that she's leaving her £6 million Lisbon palace, after revealing she feels 'bored and lonely' in the Portuguese city.

The pop superstar moved her family to southern Europe back in 2017, so her son David, 13, could fulfil his dream of playing football for Benfica's youth team.

Reported departure: The Queen of Pop is said to be leaving her Lisbon home, more than two years after moving to Portugal to support her son David, 14, as he pursued his football dreams

A source said of the star, who is enjoying a resurgence in popularity after the release of her album Madame X: 'Madonna will be on her Madame X tour until March 2020 so hasn’t been spending much time at the palace she was renting in Portugal.

'David still has some school commitments there but as Madonna is on the road she isn’t there now and it’s not clear whether she plans on getting a new home in the area.'

MailOnline has contacted a representative for Madonna for comment at the time of publication.

Candid: At the opening night of her Madame X tour last month, the artist admitted she was 'alone and bored' for some of her time in Portugal

At the opening night of her Madame X tour at New York City's Brooklyn Academy of Music last month, the star spoke onstage about her private life and move to Portugal.

She said: 'I moved to Lisbon to be a soccer mom. I wanted to be a soccer mom. I thought it would be adventurous. But I found myself alone, without friends, a little bit bored.'

Explaining how that boredom led to her seeking out new interests, she continued: ''I was invited to a fado club. The music is made up of melancholy, sadness and longing — the best description of me.'

Madonna moved to Portugal in August of 2017, and was living in a luxury suite at the Pestana Palace in Lisbon, before moving into her grand 12-bedroom abode.

At the time of her move, it was reported that Madonna was renting the home with the option to buy a year later if she wanted to.

It was also reported that the Like A Virgin singer was dividing her time between Portugal, the US and UK as her son David, who she adopted from Malawi in 2006, pursued his football ambitions.

Madonna is also mother to daughter Lourdes, 22, who is believed to live in America and son Rocco, 19, who resides in London with his father Guy Richie and stepmother Jacqui Ainsley.

The pop star adopted daughters Mercy, 13, and six-year-old twins, Stella and Esther, who live with her in Lisbon.
